title: Public transit ridership distribution
caption: Comparison between 2019 (baseline) and subsequent years' public transit ridership on high frequency routes within January, 2020 and December, 2020 in Austin, TX.
insights: Between January and February 2020, mean ridership was 55% higher than that of 2019.
By the end of March 2020, mean ridership across all routes had dropped to -17% below the baseline and continued to drop until May 2020 where it reached -39% points below that of March.
The decline in ridership slightly reduced at the end of June but has remained at an average of -47% below the baseline.

The routes used in the analysis include 10-South 1st/Red River, 17-Cesar Chavez, 18-Martin Luther King, 2-Rosewood, 20-Manor Rd/Riverside, 300-Springdale/Oltorf, 311-Stassney, 325-Metric/Rundberg, 333-William Cannon, 335-335 35th/38th, 4-7th Street, 7-Duval / Dove Springs, 801-N Lamar S Congress and 803-Burnet/S Lamar
